item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 9:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (214 points | 66 comments)
2. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (317 points | 126 comments)
3. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (712 points | 260 comments)
4. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (118 points | 141 comments)

7. How the US defense secretary circumvents official DoD communications equipment (174 points | 126 comments)

10. Zhaoxin's KX-7000 (144 points | 35 comments)

14. Reversible computing with mechanical links and pivots (140 points | 64 comments)
15. I Found Malware in a BeamNG Mod (97 points | 12 comments)
16. A competing theory to 'dark energy' suggests universe has different time zones (24 points | 10 comments)

21. Future of OSU Open Source Lab in Jeopardy (225 points | 76 comments)
22. GroMo (YC W21) Is Hiring ( | hide)
23. Home washing machines fail to remove important pathogens from textiles (40 points | 57 comments)
24. You Wouldn't Download a Hacker News (403 points | 212 comments)
25. Wyze pays $255k of tariffs on $167k of floodlights (126 points | 72 comments)
26. Julia Parsons, U.S. Navy Code Breaker During World War II, Dies at 104 (126 points | 10 comments)
27. The True Size Of (249 points | 114 comments)
28. Show HN: ART – a new open-source RL framework for training agents (88 points | 10 comments)
29. Show HN: Convert Large CSV/XLSX to JSON or XML in Browser (21 points | 6 comments)
30. Strings Just Got Faster (11 points | discuss)
